item.title: Report X-2024051794
item.description:
Report X-2024051794

Identified by scraper @ 2024-06-14T15:12:47+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-29
  • City: SIOUX CITY
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 20000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 4-29-2024 a CN transportation employee observed liquid dripping from the bottom outlet valve, loading equipment was observed to still be attached with the cap dangling during routing work operations at the CN Sioux City Yard in Sioux City, IA. The employee initiated an emergency response from the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The tank car has been set out on an isolation track (SC98) The transportation Employee placed a bucket underneath the rail car to contain the leak. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The CN contractor found loading equipment was still attached and the cap was not attached but dangling by the chain. The attached loading valve was less than tool tight leaking from the threads. The BOV valve handle was cycled several times to the open and closed position to free any debris that may have been trapped in the BOV sealing surface potentially causing the leak. The loading equipment valve was removed from the car and the bov valve was observed for 20 minutes to ensure there was no further leakage from the valve. The bottom outlet valve cap gasket was inspected and replaced. The BOV cap was then re-installed and tightened with a 36" pipe wrench.
